oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Chip Young - 2010-10-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of Chip Young from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on October 9, 2010.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chip Young;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hosted by Bill Lloyd. Includes selected excerpts from recordings and audio from video. Subjects include: Early upbringing and musical inspiration -- Early days as a musician -- Origin of the name change from Jerry Stembridge to Chip Young -- Military career -- Being friends with Jerry Reed and getting letters in Korea from him while in the military -- Story about Bobby Vinton session and Grady Martin's comments about his guitar playing -- Playing with Faron Young in Austin Texas for the inauguration of Lyndon Johnson -- Recording session work and working with Elvis Presley -- Story about Elvis and his karate moves in the studio damaging Chip's guitar -- Working with Jerry Lee Lewis and the recording of Chantilly Lace -- Working with Tom T. Hall recording Old Dogs, Children and Watermelon Wine -- Opening his own recording studio and records recorded there -- Producing and recording Billy Swan's I Can Help -- Plays guitar part from the recording of Jolene with Dolly Parton --

Story about Jerry Reed and building a model airplane -- Working with Jerry Reed on movies -- Guitar thumbpicking styles -- Touring the world -- Woodworking hobby -- Plays Run, Buddy Run on guitar -- Closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Young, Chip; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
